review: It's a great game overall, my biggest complaint is how pay to win the game can be, about 75 percent of the items in the shop are bought with money, which makes it so much easier to level up cards instantly. I don't like about paying for mobile games, so I've always been a free to play user. There's been some challenges against pay to win users, but nothing major if you manage to have good level cards

I've played this game for about 5 months now and I love it. Compared to other phone games you can actually lose games and learn strategies to build better decks and combos. The only negative thing I have to say about it is it's definitely a pay-to-win game. Players in Arena 10 are spawning champions and spamming op cards that can't be unlocked until 6 arenas later

Honestly I think the game was in a good spot and still is, but for whatever reason they decided to add... merge tactics (of all things) to it, instead of maybe improving on the clan gameplay? And they locked away the ranked mode which was really fun. One step forward, two steps back. The matchmaking feels better overall though for some time now.

I really like most of the changes that the game has made over the years, I just wish that it was more f2p friendly, bring back the season shop, but better, making it easier to get the things the shop had to offer, the evo shards, currencies, cards, it would be nice if they added elite wildcards too, but maybe it's too much to ask. But there's a lot of potential in that idea, bringing back the trading tokens or whatever, I think it would make everyone happy.

I won't lie, Clash is a great is an amazing game to play. They now have two different gamemodes and they're both pretty fun to play. The only thing I'm not too happy about is the part where they removed the shop, the one that pretty much carried us free to play players in collecting evo's. Now we have to wait for events like this or gotta buy our way through the game.

As a free to play player with 8+ years I've seen this game change and grow. All the good stuff and the bad. It's a better state now then it was a few years ago. Some things are still not balanced but things have been shaping up recently. The competitive nature of the game feels lacking with no incentive to play ranked. As of recently they changed trophyroad and ranked once more linking the two. Hitting 15000 unlocks ranked and resets at the end of the season to 12000 which is a horrible change.

After almost 7 years of playing and staying positive. The newest update just spells Pay to Win. For the past few years I always enjoyed Party mode over climbing a ladder with an unbalanced algorithm. Party mode was the only way I earn gold coins to level up to 14. You have taken that away to replace with Pay to Win Party mode. The max amount daily is capped at 1000 which is accomplished in a few rounds. You need to pay to collect double amount with a time limit. Who ask for this update?

This makes the game unplayable if you don't put in enough money to level your troops up to what is typical for your ladder points. Every match is either a clear win or loss right from the start, since it solely depends on what levels yours and the opponent's cards have.
